website_summaries.verdict: A well-made tool from a respected brand, providing gardeners with reliable value.
pros: Coated, hardened steel blades make for efficient cutting and quick cleaning
Good ergonomics and easy slide locking
cons: Unreliable product control means some people have been disappointed by poor tools

customer_reviews.title: I guess I learned not to buy Fiskars
customer_reviews.text: The delivery and packaging was right on time, and the product was as promised - a pair of Fiskars pruning shears. But the utility of the product was another story. I bought these Fiskars pruning shears and a pair of Fiskars loppers, because the brand is well-known, which I (wrongly) assumed counted for quality. I mean, how do you get to be well-known if your product doesn't work? Neither of them were sharp, and the blades of these little pruners ... I'm not sure how to explain this... preferred to spread sideways - path of least resistance - instead of straight through the small bush branches I was trying to prune. I'm going to try to send both back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Price

customer_reviews.title: Issues after first use
customer_reviews.text: After first use trimming thin (less than 1/4") branches of our christmas tree: - the safety lock got loose after first - coating on the one blade (steel) was scraped off by the other blade (black). At the same time they were very sharp out the package but not sure how long they would stay in working and safe condition given how it all started. So they were returned.
customer_reviews.author: olsaf

customer_reviews.title: Blades not meeting
customer_reviews.text: I guess it is sloppy design or bad quality control. I got one and the last 1/4 to 1/2 inch isn't going to cut. If you click on the photo you can see what I mean. I ordered a replacement. Same thing. If you end up with one of these and the tip won't cut, try reaming out the hole on the silver/shiny blade. (The metal is quite hard!) Push the two parts to meet, and re-tighten the bolt. You may also need to trim the rubber grip on the bottom handle. On mine it bumps into the top portion also helping it to not close all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Geno T.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these friskars for my mother for Christmas. She just opened them yesterday and tried to trim mum stems and the friskars broke instantly. Now, they are as good as garbage because they do not work, the balde does not close all the way- it is out of alignment.A complete waste of money and completely embarrassing that I gave someone a defective gift. I would NOT recommend this product or any other products made by this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Shears
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on July 31, 2017 and got them a few days later. There doesn't seem to be any kind of spring in them so in order to use them I have to manually open them, put them around the branch, squeeze the handles and then manually open them again. That doesn't make sense! The attached picture shows how far they open on their own. Also, the locking mechanism broke. I had to buy a new pair at Lowe's today.
customer_reviews.author: mandykat

customer_reviews.title: Blade is Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, on the first pair the blade bent on the first cut! The second pair lasted longer, but that is only because I haven't been pruning anything for a while, but the bent also. And I wasn't cutting hard wood either, I was pruning a rose bush! Stay away from these pruning shears!
customer_reviews.author: randrsn

customer_reviews.title: Great Cutter Snips, great value...
customer_reviews.text: Tough set of clippers! I'm a bee keeper, and bought these snips to aid in removing swarms from trees... I needed quality snips that cut clean and easy, not ones that build up force from squeezing and chops (thus violently shaking the branch)... super sharp blade and perfect lever action is what you get with these snips... I've only used it on about a 7/8" branch, but it cut it like butter on a hot day... easy enough to use to snip away delicate little branches as well... great product but that's what I've always come to expect from Fiskar products and they never disappoint...
customer_reviews.author: Rlbrignac

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy. NOT as depicted in Product Photos.
customer_reviews.text: What I liked: The anticipation of writing this review. What I Disliked: These are NOT the same Pruning Shears as depicted in the photos. Regardless of how these cut, they aren’t the same Shears depicted online and therefore, on the grounds of deceit, deserve 1 Star. Perhaps even less than 1 Star because not only are they different than depicted in the photos, but they suck.
customer_reviews.author: braxton aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable grip, will slice thru branches smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars All Steel Bypass Pruning Shears Maximum cutting capacity: 5/8 inch diameter My hand size is average to small, mature woman. These feel very comfortable I have used for about an hour trimming branches, and such from overgrowth in back yard by a wooded area. Yes they are new so they sliced quickly with no problem. I have other Fiskars products for many years all have been used, abused and kept on clipping. I needed an extra shears for a quick grab and clip garden bucket. These fit the job.
customer_reviews.author: Emma M

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars for the win!
customer_reviews.text: I love these Pruning Shears!!! I purchased them to trim some hanging branches and some shrubs. They worked like a charm! They are so sharp and easy to use. I didn’t have to squeeze very hard on most of them. But if they were about 1/2” diameter I used the shears to score the branch then bend it and then used the shears to cut it off. The handles are covered with a textured rubber so they are slip resistant and feel slightly padded. I had no trouble using them, even with RA/OA in my hands. I am so pleased with these shears and proud of the work that got done because of them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle N

customer_reviews.title: Ugh -- it's HORRIBLE now
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few of these over the years, but my most recent purchase must have been a lemon. They barely open and barely close (and I'm quite sure I have the lock disengaged, so that's not it). Their operation is extremely unergonomic -- it sticks, and it has a "mushy" closure now. The blades arrived dull as dirt. What happened -- these pruners used to be great! Switching to some pruners recommended by the Wirecutter. They didn't even look at Fiskers, so that should tell you something.
customer_reviews.author: cm

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done. inexpensive. one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked Fiskars branded products. In the past they have worked well for me. I like the sharpness of this tool and the handles are comfortable. My only gripe is, when I am pruning with the tool upward, the sliding lock mechanism often slides down due to gravitational pull and locks the blades closed while in use. This gets very annoying. I've tried tightening the mechanism to no avail. I'll use them but with something jammed into the slot to keep them open. Shouldn't have to do that. Bad design in my opinion, but for the price, not bad.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Completely terrible garden clippers.
customer_reviews.text: These Fiskars garden hand clippers are as poor as they get. I've had 50 year old clippers that were more useful than these. Within one hour of use, they were not cutting anything even close to a pencil thickness. Even smaller pieces had to be cut over and over, and then twisted and torn apart in the clippers, and then if it actually cut I would have to pry the clippers open with two hands. About the worst clippers I have ever used. I am a woman gardener and not very rough on garden clippers - these should have lasted longer than one hour of use.
customer_reviews.author: NYC gal

customer_reviews.title: Used them once, and the blade chipped
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars, a very well made brand. That said, I was surprised that the first time I used these hand snips, the blade chipped and I was unable to fully close it and lock it. I have a blade sharpener that I will use to try to get the chip out. You get what you pay for. Just wasn't expecting it to break the first time I used it. Otherwise, it is sharp and easy to use. It cut the little branches off a sapling very easily. I probably wouldn't buy these again and would upgrade to the $50 version.
customer_reviews.author: DixieLady

customer_reviews.title: Tighten the bolts holding the blades
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price. They feel good in your hand. The lock is easy to remove. They're pretty sharp. I didn't like the blades separating as your trying cut a branch. The blades are flimsy and the bolts holding the blades need to be tightened precisely. If they're too tight you can't get the cutter to spring open and if too lose the blades separating as your trying cut a branch.
customer_reviews.author: C. baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Better than the prior model
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shears, because I like Fiscar products and I needed a new pair anyway. I had a previous version that had the devo hat, springy thing between the handles and hated them because they got stuck in the closed position after a while. I've been using this pair for about one month now and love the quick release button. Makes me feel like a ninja with a pocket knife when I release the shears to open. They open effortlessly and smartly. They are super sharp out of the box, like the brand is known for. They do exactly, what I hoped for them to do. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.  Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Had a cheap pair of pruners that were just about dead and decided to upgrade to something with a guarantee backed by a valid brand. I had these pruners for less than an hour before I went back to Amazon and purchased another set of my old ones. Not sure how they pulled off such an uncomfortable grip on a pruner, but this will probably be tossed in the back of my garden shed and forgotten about. Only pulled out in times of desperation. Fair bit disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, don't get for serious yard work.
customer_reviews.text: I used them today for the 1st time to cut roses for my vase. They were OK on small rose stems, on dry rose stems within the size requirement they were very hard to use and cut through. So these are just OK for goofing around and green thin stems, not very useful on anything stronger. My other older shears will cut through way tougher branches and easier to cut through. Then again other shears are by Craftsman, so could be these are just seriously out classed.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Bertinazzi

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought 30 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a regular mom that likes to try to keep her fresh flowers as long as possible. For the past 30 years I've been meaning to buy something like this. I've just always used a kitchen knife and it would take me forever to cut fresh ends on flowers, especially on rose stems. These schears are exactly what I needed. They work perfect, slice through the rose stems like butter. I would definitely recommend these. Hopefully I don't lose them.
customer_reviews.author: aaustad

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I want to update my first review which was unfavorable. Afterwards, I noticed that this product had a lifetime warranty so I contacted Fiskars and told them mine never worked properly. They sent me a new pair that work great. I originally gave 1 star and said: I have had these pruners for a bit over a year. They never worked great but now they have already stopped cutting anything no matter where I position the "sweet spot" of the blade. Will be tossing out. Would never purchase this brand again." Thanks to their customer service, I can now recommend.
customer_reviews.author: hd

customer_reviews.title: Light yet powerful
customer_reviews.text: I use Fiskars Steel Bypass Pruning Shears (91095935J) for pruning anything that will fit within its open jaws. I suspect that sometimes I am using it to cut branches that are thicker than recommended by the manufacturer. Nontheless, the shears are able to cut through the thickest limbs. It's light. It's small - it fits in my back jeans pocket. The blades have stayed sharp for several months now. I did leave these outside for several days. They got wet and the handles lost their elasticity - my fault of course. A little lubricant sprayed on the blades and they are good as new. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: The can-do-it-all pair of gardening shears
customer_reviews.text: I admittedly don't do a ton of gardening, but I was very impressed by these Fiskars shears ability to dominate practically any size branch/stem that I could fit into its jaws. I cut down several large branches off a tree in my front yard and when processing it to smaller pieces, these shears could even tackle half-inch thick branches. I'd say that if you plan on using these for general gardening, cutting flower stems or thick weeds, these bad boys will tear through those tasks. If you need to cut thicker items, these will also do the trick but likely wear them out much faster. When my pair dies, I definitely plan on re-ordering the same pair.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: They were getting a bit grubby even with good care so I ordered a new pair
customer_reviews.text: I have used Fiskars All Steel Bypass Pruning Shears for years. I think I had the last pair for twenty years, They were getting a bit grubby even with good care so I ordered a new pair. The locking switch in the current design does not stay engaged and with the slightest bump, the shears open. Disappointing and dangerous. The previous shears had a notch with a "finger" which could be rotated into it so there was impossible to bump it, causing it to open.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the package
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that, right out of the package, the shears felt a bit stiff. After light use, the blades would no longer come together at the tip and, because of this, could no longer be locked. While the blades were definitely sharp and continued to cut branches near the pruner's hinge, they were not properly adjusted and would not cut anywhere near the tip. I've contacted Fiskars (warranty@fiskars.com) and hope they'll honor their lifetime warranty at no expense to me. Maybe the next pair will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Susan in Austin TX

customer_reviews.title: Low quality. Others have much better products at about the same price point.
customer_reviews.text: Mediocre... They will cut some materials well enough, but the blade and hinge flex enough that the often just twist and whatever you are trying to cut gets wedged in. Now that I've started using higher quality garden tools from Tabor and others, for about the same price, it's really clear to me how much Fiskars has declined in quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Same hand pruner as our local lowes has and for much less. With free shipping it's a total win. I do a ton of pruning throughout the year. I replace my pruners yearly because we live in a really humid area and between the rust and the constant use in my garden (and home orchard) they don't last long. At this price I don't mind investing in new ones when I need them. I buy limb loppers every other year. I found some on here where I saved at least ten dollars on them over Lowe's prices. Great products at lower prices. Brick and mortar can't compete, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I e had these for a few months for my indoor plants, but the blades are so bent and damaged you’d think I’ve been pruning steel branches. Terrible quality, the “locking” mechanism never worked and the metal they are made of is flimsy. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere, these should not be in the market!
customer_reviews.author: Mfb

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made....junk. Spring let go after first cut. I had to open them up and repair them, and don't have time to do this every time I use them, which appears will be the case. I will use them til I tire of fixing them, and they will be tossed in the dumpster. What a waste of material. Not happy. Definitely would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JPH

customer_reviews.title: Really want to like it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great when it is brand new. I powered through all scrubs and weeds without any problem. Unfortunately, after a few usage, the spring broke. The piece of metal that is holding the handles to expand broke. It couldn't automatically expand the handles to continue using it. I blame they used poor quality piece of metal. Don't buy it until they fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lee

customer_reviews.title: Splay open on a 3/8" branch.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with these. I have shears from 15 years ago that do a better job. I was trying to prune root suckers from my ornamental pear tree and the branches were not more than 3/8" in diameter. Each time the blades would splay open and around the branch instead of cutting into the branch. I will be looking for a different brand. As other have said - not what they used to be. So sick of Chinese junk. You just wind up paying more in the long run because you have to constantly replace the item. Yet it is next to impossible to find anything that is built with quality anymore.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Superior cutters
customer_reviews.text: We used to have a pair of similar cutters for years but then those were misplaced and we couldn’t find them anymore. We decided to buy these after a while. They arrived in perfect condition. They were ten times stronger and more durable than our previous cutters. The lock mechanism works a lot better too compared to the latch option we had previously. As far as price point, we technically ended up paying the same price. Made me feel like I got ripped off on my previous purchase. Definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Peppa Unboxing

customer_reviews.title: Great pruners
customer_reviews.text: Great product, as you would expect from Fiskars. Ordered a second set because I had misplaced the first. After finding the old set, I noticed that the original set was obviously worn in comparison though it had been subjected to hard use over a couple of years, including being left out in the rain for a couple days. But with a little bit of oil and gentle filing, the older set worked almost as well as the brand new one. Keeping the blade clean makes a huge difference and helps prolong the life. I often get carried away with trimming branches that are too thick but these are very durable and continue to work in spite of the abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas V.

customer_reviews.title: Best In My Opinion
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I had these shears many years ago and when they needed to be replaced, I purchased a different brand. I soon regretted that decision, and have learned my lesson! I am back to tried and true Fiskars brand. Highly recommend these. Others I have tried were difficult to unlock and kept sticking when trying to cut. These provide a clean cut every time. No sticking and are easy to unlock and lock again for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Gemma Finds

customer_reviews.title: not what I expected from Fiskars
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for a few days now, and it just doesn't spring open like I'd want. I have to wait for it to open all the way before I move on to the next branch to clip. Fairly disappointed. *update* Seems to be getting worse. I have a tiny yard... maybe 20 small plants/bushes between my two yards and this product is already failing.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, cheap, the brand name means nothing
customer_reviews.text: I expected top quality from Fiskars, but these are about like any random no-name off brand. Simplistic construction obviously for a price point. The blade is getting nicked after an hour's light use. The operation is rough and crunchy when it should be smooth. These are basically functional but only at the low-expectations low end.
customer_reviews.author: Yet another customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the spring mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Love Fiskars products normally. Use their small clippers in the grow house all the time. Assumed the shears would be just as good but was wrong. The spring return on the blades is not strong enough to keep the shears open between cuts. Get the slightest sap or debris/bark and the shear locks closed. I can understand reducing the spring pressure so us old folks don’t get tired hands from squeezing but to have to manually reset the shears after every cut is awful. Will dis-assemble, oil up and try again... maybe get a stronger spring from the hardware store
customer_reviews.author: Ken Jensen

customer_reviews.title: absolutely defective line of products!!!
customer_reviews.text: Quality was bad but now it is even worse I have purchased previouslyPruning shears and they got doll in about 2 miles that was very quick! it was impossible to use them afterwards no this season I decided to purchase another pair because I was unable to contact manufacturer! I just got yesterday new pair open it up and the blades were jumpy stalking in between!! we tried several times to regulate loosen the main Bolt but nothing helps in this product supposed to be removed from Amazon! this is absolutely defective line of products!!!
customer_reviews.author: OB

customer_reviews.title: A STEAL FOR UNDER 10 BUCKS
customer_reviews.text: These are sharp cutters that I use in the yard for a million little jobs. The lock system is a knob pushed forward to open and back to close. It stays in position while using. The curve of the blade works well and this pair of pruning shears does not need much physical force to use. I also use them for around the house tasks like opening packages and cutting those plastic binds.
customer_reviews.author: Curious One

customer_reviews.title: Good pruning shears at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Our pruning shears that we have had for years have seen better days. I found these and for the price decided to give them a try. I was quite happy with what we received. They work fine as I expect Fiskar shears to work. They use a piece of spring steel in the handle to force them open as opposed to a spring like some more expensive ones. In my experience that is not always the most durable system. But, for the price, if these wear out after a period of use, I can always replace them, knowing I got more than my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: Great pruning shears!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice pruning shears. I've used Fiskar shears for many years and always been pleased with the quality. I needed a replacement set and bought these, expecting them to have the same excellent quality but also the same sometimes-difficult blade lock that my older Fiskars have. I was pleasantly surprised to see that this new pair has a very simple slide-up-and-lock feature to lock the blades. This requires a simple push with the thumb instead of the old balky and difficult to use locking mechanism that had to be forced into place. Nice improvement, Fiskars!
customer_reviews.author: FLGardener

customer_reviews.title: These worked great
customer_reviews.text: My complex management is blowing off taking care of the little tree sprouts coming out of the rocks and said people like them. It's a rock bed who want's weeds? So I got these for one that grows right up into my air conditioner as a full little tree it's just a baby now but it's sprouting from the old thick branches they cut from the old management doing a lousey job. My neighbor since I'm disabled got down in there with these and it took some work but he got quite the pile so I should be good for the summer and my ac safe. Their a nice strong sharp tool.
customer_reviews.author: Call me KID

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable and easy to use. Right now, the lock works well. The lock is my only concern with this product. I have an identical product purchased a few years ago that this replaces. The only reason for the replacement is the fact that the lock broke. With grandchildren around, that was not safe. Otherwise, the pruners, with an annual sharpening, worked very well. My wife and I use these pruners for three seasons every year. I expect years of service from these pruners.
customer_reviews.author: drbobstl

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactorily weak spring loaded handle.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because Fiskar makes such good sewing scissors that I thought I would be confident in a Fiskar cutting tool.The blades cut well, however, the handle does not open back up again on its own since the spring inside is too weak. So you’re constantly trying to open the blade back up for the next cut with your other hand or the cutting hand... I have dropped them many times trying to get them to open for the next cut. I’ve decided just not to use them any more. A shame since the blades do their work.
customer_reviews.author: J. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Work like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I like this little shears. They are super sharp and thin enough that you can cut close to a bud or stem without damaging the surrounding area. I use them mostly on my raspberry and blackberry bushes along with some flowers. I really can't say enough good about these and I think the price is perfect for the quality. Also, these lock really easy, but they also stay unlocked well so you don't have to worry about always unlocking them while you are cutting away (something that happens with other shears I have used).
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Really nice.
customer_reviews.text: nice feel in the hand and easy to use. You don't have to be a person with a massive hand to use these! It's a good thing, because mine are the same size they were when I was a teen (I am admittedly a 'few' years older). These were delivered quickly and I am very happy. In fact, I opened the box and took them directly to my garden to use them. Only thing that stopped me is the 95+ F temperature right now. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: S. K. Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Not pro quality, but works great, good value.
customer_reviews.text: These were just as expected. They are molded plastic with seemingly good quality blades. The locking mechanism works easily with a flick of the thumb so you won’t be cursing that they are impossible to close. At this price, I would be happy if they lasted a season or two and I would guess I’ll get more than that from this pair. Not an heirloom or professional grade tool, but useful and relatively durable. Recommended among all the similar choices for meeting my gardening needs at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: LXXV

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: When I originally purchased these , I was replacing an expensive pair of shears I lost that my husband bought me . After buying several at the store - I gave up due to the shears breaking. I came across this and was hesitant due to price ( to good to be true). That being said the ratings were high and I thought I could always return . Well so far I pruned my rose bushes several of them and other gardening areas. Even my husband used them . Not bad actually they work very well .Im impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Day

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Effective Pruning Shears
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these pruning shears are very competitive in terms of how ergonomic they are. These Fiskars shears are an improvement over my last three pairs of shears, and I am an avid gardener. I use these shears on my enormous cactuses, my rose bushes, on oak tree limbs, and on huge stubborn bush weeds. I have noticed only a hint of sulking so far, and it’s certainly because I’m getting good use out of them. For ten dollars or less, these pruning shears are a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Fawcett

customer_reviews.title: Definitely sharp. Worked really well but the grip is ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely sharp. Worked really well but the grip is a little weird for me. I have a hard time using one hand. I was working on some overgrown plants and I had to grip a bunch with one hand and use the shears with the other. It was a little difficult to keep cutting without having to re- adjust my grip.
customer_reviews.author: Dogmama

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are quite amazing!! I was a little hesitant to buy these because the price is SO good. But I needed something to trim branches on my pine trees and didn’t want anything too big or expensive. When I came across these like I said I was hesitant. BUT Fiskars brand has a good reputation and after reading the reviews on these I decided to give them a try. I am SO HAPPY with my purchase. They just got delivered today so I went out and put them to use right away. They were better then I ever expected. Amazing product!!! Will be buying more to have on hand for this killer deal!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Made quick work of my Gardening tasks - recommended
customer_reviews.text: As long as you keep it in good shape (i.e. oil it, keep it relatively sharp) this thing is a little beats. My plants cringe in terror when I bring this out bc I am a plant barber with this thing. I docked a star because the steel is a bit soft, but if you have something that can keep the shears in good shape, and some oil to keep the shears working without resistance, this is a must-have for your garden/back yard tasks. Well constructed and will not be the last Fiskars product I buy
customer_reviews.author: C. Hernandez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great for thick stems/roses etc. Fiskars doesn't necessarily have the toughest/highest quality products out there, but they have a top notch warranty. I buy their products since they have such a great warranty and customer service that I don't need the need to spend more on other brands. I know if I break the tool they'll cover it no questions asked. Fill out the claim and send a picture with it.. good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory shears
customer_reviews.text: This was primarily a replacement purchase for prior Fiskars shears. Bought these since familiar with them and did not want to pay more for unknown, more expensive choices. Having said that I emphasize 'satisfactory' shears; not great. When new they generally work well for a time, then show their wear. One of these is already squeaking and binding when engaging for use. Some shears have worn better than others with either the sharpness or lock becoming suspect first.
customer_reviews.author: Steve66

customer_reviews.title: It's beautiful in Durham North Carolina
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair I've bought. One for me in California and one for my daughter in North Carolina. On a recent visit to my daughter's home, the sent pruners were put to good use by me. I loved pruning her hedges with these due to all the overgrowth from all the rain and sunshine there. I wish I took a before and after pictures of her yard. It looked great. The clippers were comfortable to hold and easy to use. I was clipping for over an hour and no soreness experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Robin's nest

customer_reviews.title: Quality  all the way
customer_reviews.text: These are quality implements that will be useful as long as you have that garden outside. There are only 2 things to remember: 1-keep them lightly oiled and out of the rain. People think you use them outdoors so they can stay on the patio or garage. No, keep them indoors in that tool drawer, tool box, or on the wall. In a heavy humidity or wet place they will rust or deteriorate. 2-don't want to sound like your parents, but please check your fingers as you use them. I know you'd never slip up, but just please be careful; one mistake and...
customer_reviews.author: Beantown Jim

customer_reviews.title: They last about 3-4 months with light use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these in mid April 2020. I've used them a handful of times to trim bougainvillea. I keep them in an outdoor storage closet. I noticed them becoming rusted and dull in August and now it's Oct 2020 and they are completely useless. Also. I purchased them for $9.98. Now that it's prime day they are $11.99. Prime Day ups the price and then gives you a $3.50 discount and you wind up really saving $1.49. Not the mega-Prime Day savings it seems to be.
customer_reviews.author: Zma

customer_reviews.title: Not Sharp- Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I have bought numerous Fiskars gardening products, including several pruners which have been great. These, however are horrible. I do not reccommend these at all. I used them only once, to cut very small branches off of a crape myrtle trees. After snipping only about 20 branches, they had already dulled, and stopped cutting through. The blades twisted and would not meet any longer. Again- very small branches. Was extremely disappointed with these.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Trims large rose bushes with ease!
customer_reviews.text: I got these larger fiskars after finding success with the brand for their small trimmers that were great for clipping indoor plants, and small branches outside. When I had to trim my 1/2" thick dead rose stalks to prepare for the season, these fiskars cut through the branch like a knife through butter. Easily handles my roses, and I even used to trim small branches on my trees. It says up to 5/8" thickness, and I can confirm that. Very comfortable grip does not slip when applying torque for thicker cuts. I'm a lefty, and they work great for me. Would recommend to anyone looking to snip things with easy under 1".
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Not at all up to "fisker" quality .... binds from the minute I got it out of the package.
customer_reviews.text: Just received and tried to use. Mechanism bound....spring return got caught up and binded. Had to WD-40 it myself all over to get it to work. OH....you can send the work to China, but at least have the decency to do quality control. I'm really, really agitated after decades on depending on this brand name. Let's see if it now works ok in the yard!!! Once you guys loose your reputation, people will just by any other brand instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Reworked,  then didn't, then did!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped retracting within five minutes of use... Took apart and reassembled worked fine for the rest of the day. The issue was with the return spring that pushes the moving jaw back into position. That spring can move away from its position beneath the moving jaw and trap it from opening again. Had the spring been wider this problem will not arise. Solution find a way to keep that spring stationary underneath the moving jaw. The pruner did its job once it was fixed and expect to do so for many years.
customer_reviews.author: A_Uzer

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shears, I bring them with me when I go fishing to bleed any catches that we want to keep. They make things so much easier, I haven't had any problems with rust or them getting stuck at all. They're great on trees/vegetation too, I ended up buying 2 pairs!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: It cuts your thumb sized branches with breeze. The opening width of the handle is a bit wide for women's hand but I can handle it. The safely closure button in the middle is a bit struggle to snag when you have the garden gloves but manageable. Nice and big cutting blade.
customer_reviews.author: maya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small branches.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to prune some over growth that I had in my backyard and front yard. These are extremely sharp, durable, and effective. It takes little to no effort to cut a 1/4" diameter branch or smaller. I've been successful with cutting approximately 1/2" diameter branches too. These are easy to store. I just make sure to wipe them off with a clean rag after I'm done using them so that I don't leave any sap or water on them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: They aren't my old Fiskar trimming shears
customer_reviews.text: I tried out these new shears today and I wasn't really happen with them. I had trouble almost always when even cutting 1/4" live branches from bushes. The cutting blade even crosses the thick blade as if there is too much slop on the shears. They fit well in my hand and are quite sharp - they just bind and don't cut cleanly like my old Fiskars. Just not real happy with the product - maybe I didn't buy the same quality though. I have used other Fiskar products and will say all have been tough, good, and up to the job products.
customer_reviews.author: Was Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No spring and cheap plastic - not Fiskar quality
customer_reviews.text: I expected to have the same quality as all Fiskar products but unfortunately I was disappointed. There is no spring so you have to manually open up the clippers every time you go to close them. the lock is very cheap plastic and will absolutely break or disintegrate within a month so I am returning mine. I’m starting to think that a lot of the things I’m purchasing on Amazon are of lesser quality than what they once were and it’s starting to concern me.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: These are sturdy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy, easy to use, easy to grasp, easy to close (orange plastic/rubber slider). They will make a clean cut on roses and also cut through most bougainvillea branches--except for the very widest ones. They don't gather a lot of sap or debris on the blades either. I've had more expensive pruners that fell apart. As a rule, I don't keep these outdoors because I don't want them to rust (as previous pruners have) so I can't say if they are weatherproof or not.
customer_reviews.author: Marla hart

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: We had an older pair of this same tool that broke because of how the two sides were connected. This newer version is much more sturdy, because everything is enclosed. And the locking mechanism is much easier to use...it stays open or closed, wherever you want it, unlike the previous toggle switch that would lock itself unintentionally. They're also very sharp, and can cut pretty good size twigs/branches. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark MAC

customer_reviews.title: Plating peeled off in less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: Why is Fiskars hiding their country of manufacture? These must be made in china. The plating started peeling off on first use. In less than a month it's now rusting. I will no longer buy from companies that manufacture in china. Update: Fiskars has also adopted chinese customer service standards. Fiskars Customer service by phone has been terminated. And online warranty claims are completely ignored.
customer_reviews.author: C. K. Jaguar

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, long lasting brand
customer_reviews.text: Great price. My current pair I’ve had (identical) for 20 yrs. I don’t remember a spring without them. I recently bought 2 new pairs (one for friend, new gardener). Fiskars is a good quality brand. I’ve never had trouble with them. Old pair are looking rough, but still not too dull. I’ve never sharpened them. I had originally thought I’d buy myself a new pair & sharpen the old pair for my friend, the new gardener. As it turns out, I bought two identical pairs, one from Amazon & the other from Home Depot, lol. I love my Fiskars pruners & I know my friend will love hers, too.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Hall

customer_reviews.title: incomplete cuts
customer_reviews.text: whoa. these shears knocked fiskars off its high pedestal of quality. numberous cuts needed on small branches because it leaves them shredded with fibrous ends. it just does not cut properly. have to get the branch in the center of the blade. forget using the tip. it does work ok on bigger branches. not my first choice when i do my hedges. my old corona is the go-to trimmer now... it works every time. i bought two of these fiskars on sale. regrets. not worth the moola saved.
customer_reviews.author: b. payne

customer_reviews.title: Great, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: We have hundreds of hand pruners and loppers on the farm. These were a cheap version we picked up to see if our volunteers would use them. They work very well, much better than you would expect at this price point. Are not as robust as they very expensive ones, but last long and hold up well and function extremely well as you would expect a Fiskar product to function. I give them an A+ My only problem is some volunteer took them home, I guess they liked them so well they just couldn't live without them. People and their tools.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Liston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pruning Shears
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars has produced many great quality items, including these pruning shears. They will easily & quickly cut small branches on trees or bushes without any real effort or strain from hand cramping. Really like the easy-lock feature.. and not high-priced...always a plus. Am planning on purchasing more Fiskars gardening tools in the future.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!  Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: These are awful - complete garbage! As soon as I opened them, they never closed again completely and the blade gouged itself on the other side of the trimmers, ruining the edge which wasn't particularly sharp to begin with. I tried trimming one small branch with them and they left a jagged, incomplete cut. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mraur

customer_reviews.title: Stands behind their products
customer_reviews.text: Love them. They get the job done. Bought in 2015. The small orange plastic slide lock came off and I couldn't find it. They still work of course but cant be locked in the closed position. I contacted them and asked for another plastic pc. OMGosh they sent a whole new shear!!!! I didn't expect that! I have 2 other products made by Friskars. I lost a spring on another small set of shears and they fixed that too, no questions asked! Great company
customer_reviews.author: Paul W. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: not top quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made I guess. I trim my roses daily and was hoping this would help but it's not smooth and sometimes an effort to cut. I thought the brand would guarantee a quality product but heck, even fruit of the loom is downhill too. I'll probably have to pay alot more to get a good product, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Deana R Smiel

customer_reviews.title: Great for pruning
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pruner i have bought so far. its simple, easy to use and quite sharp. When i bought this, i had in my mind, just a little bit of pruning of my plants here and there. But it works quite well for thicker branches upto 3- 4inches as well. The only thing i wish was, its handle to have a softer or foam like covering on it. I realised after a while that due to its rough handle i got a blister on my thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: The only good thing (or bad) is Amazon replaced it immediately with ...
customer_reviews.text: Should have read the reviews before buying! Initially you will find the cutting process handle to be somewhat sticky. Thinking nothing of that as the pruning went along very well for about 1 month. All of sudden, it is not even able to cut paper! The blades have become misaligned over such a short period of time. The only good thing (or bad) is Amazon replaced it immediately with another one without question. Now we will see how long these new ones will last. I would recommend first to read all reviews first before buying and then probably pay more for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Dronkers

customer_reviews.title: Broken! They won't even close
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time ordering Fiskar shears and the title says it all. These look and feel nice but do not work!! They won't even close enough to lock the safety. I've submitted a warranty claim to see if this was a one time issue.
customer_reviews.author: supurrrnova

customer_reviews.title: Not the product of years past
customer_reviews.text: I have an older set of these shears, which I absolutely love and use regularly. I ordered these to have an extra set when we are working in the yard together. Out if the box, the hinge was tight and very squeaky, while the blade was rather dull. After I sharpened the blade and applied wd-40 to the hinges (which IMO shouldnt need to be done out if the box) it seemed to work better but still not up to par with my other pair that is at least 4 years old. I question how long these will last... quality seems to have gone downhill, which is a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Angela K

customer_reviews.title: I too expected more from Fiskars :(
customer_reviews.text: I’m with everyone else. These shears aren’t as great as I expected. Pruning rose bushes they’re great. Pruning my Crepe Myrtles, not so much. They’re sharp enough to cut small limbs but the blades separate and don’t make an easy, nice cut. I’m disappointed in these.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Clipper is good, but spring doesn't allow this to open back up after cut
customer_reviews.text: Like the quality of the product, especially the price. However, I wish the spring allowed the clipper to open up more smoothly and easily after each cut. It causes the cutting process to slow down significantly. May try a lubricant to see if that loosens up the spring mechanism
customer_reviews.author: DVD Maven

customer_reviews.title: I hate the auto lock slider, but everything else is great
customer_reviews.text: It keeps moving sliding into place as I am using the cutters and I have to stop what I am doing to move it back, so I can continue to work. That is extremely frustrating and I am tempted to remove it all together, but when not in use, I do want them to lock in the closed position, so cannot do that. Otherwise, very good cutters - can handle thicker stems/branches than I expected. Are easy to hold and maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: MoveMeIntoBooks

customer_reviews.title: My trusted brand for gardening
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through multiple generic pruning shears, all to no avail. They say that the generic versions of things are pretty much the same thing as the branded ones, but not in this case. When it comes to gardening, nothing beats Fiskars. These shears are rock solid, and they slice through branches with ease. Spend a few extra dollars instead of buying bad quality shears over and over. Amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Rubark Established 2014

customer_reviews.title: Blade chipped after one use. Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Used this once on a branch, maybe no more than 1/4" thick, and the blade went into the metal part during the end of the cut and was apparently enough force to chip the blade. Every cut now has a trouble spot and isn't a clean cut because of it. They are pretty much useless now. Oh and of course I missed the return window because I took forever to finally use them. Would not buy this product again
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Do not spring open
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of FIxker products and I bought this because I like them. I'm unhappy with these. They cut fine and lock fine, BUT after cutting, they remain closed. The spring isn't strong enough to open them back up. This make it very difficult to use one-handed. I've tried putting silicone on the rotating joint, but this did not help at all. Perhaps I got a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Reston Ron

customer_reviews.title: Weak return spring; difficult to lock or release lock
customer_reviews.text: The internal spring is too weak to keep the sheers open; some light machine oil and a little effort is required between cuts to keep this feature semi-operational at best. The lock is darn near impossible to open and close even after lubrication. It's sad that a new pair of sheers requires so much effort to use. The narrative in the Amazon ad is not completely accurate. These sheers are overall, poor quality and I would not recommend them to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Made to last - very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend these pruning sheers. I had a pair for 8 years and recently lost them somewhere in my garden. They remained sharp - everything was still in good condition. The lock mechanism had begun to slide (not stay locked). But that was minor. Cut branches up to 1/2” and even thicker if you worked at it. VERY sturdy. So I am delighted to have a pair of these again. I use them every day.
customer_reviews.author: B J S

customer_reviews.title: What happen to Fiskars quality?
customer_reviews.text: Have owned many pruning shears- and while usually, Fiskars offers a decent product, these are frustratingly awful. These are essential new pruners. They will not close nor go from the open position to the locked. I have tried to loosen them etc without success. I am not going to continue to spend hours fixing what should be one of the simplest tools I own. I am disappointed, to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: nc hiker

customer_reviews.title: Such a deal!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great price on these Fiskars shears. I've had great luck with these in the past and have no reason to think that will be any different with this pair. Edited to say that I got these for $10 on sale at Amazon. I'm not out too much money, but these are not the old Fiskars. I've been using mine for a year or two now and they are as dull as they can be. I now get out my old ones that are probably 15 years old because they're sharper. My guess is these are a Chinese knock-off.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. I did not think to check to see ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in the winter. In spring when I got them out I discovered there is no spring on them. They are very sharp and cut well. Exactly what I depend on Fiskers for. However, these do not have a spring and I can cut a branch with one hand but must use both hands to open them only to cut another branch and again open with both hands. Exceedingly burdensome. Disappointed. I did not think to check to see if they would automatically open. Every pair I have had have opened automatically. The disadvantage of buying on line. Had I picked them up in a store I would have known the problem and not purchased
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: More junk for the landfill.
customer_reviews.text: A disappointment from a trusted manufacturer. The lock mechanism is terrible...basically just a screw head, instead of a thumb switch. Painful to operate the lock. The handles are pretty weak as well. The foam grips lack density so you feel the metal inside the foam when you squeeze. If they could be seen before the purchase, nobody would buy these. More junk for the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Munrow

customer_reviews.title: Must have inexpensive and we'll made
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. The weight was not too heavy easy to cut branches as you see the pile of it in my picture. It was a nice feel to it for the grip. And the orange color made looking for it easy if when I dropped it walking around. I did cutting mango branches and bamboo tree, they were as big as an inches and many other trees in my yard. It was a clean sharp cut. Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.author: Bounphengphongsavath

customer_reviews.title: This is our second pair of these shears in a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is our second pair of these shears in a year. The last pair we put through some heavy use--but nothing crazy. It worked really well until the internal spring just popped out one day while I was cutting carrots. Maybe those were a dud or we worked them too hard. They are relatively inexpensive so we didn't mind buying a replacement. New pair seems to be smoother. FOr reference, we had used the shears to cut through grass squares we got from home depot. Also used them to cut through plastic turn and to cut carrots into bite sized pieces for our puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Susan T

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: When I received these clippers my first reaction was "They must have sent the wrong product." The clippers felt clunky and looked cheap. On the very first cut the chrome plating on the blades started peeling off. The blades dented shortly after while trimming 1/4 inch branches on my Japanese maple tree and dulled within 10 minutes. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for, highly recommend these fabulous clippers!! 🙂
customer_reviews.text: These are fabulous!! I have arthritis and was looking for something compact yet mighty to trim some overgrowth near my home/sidewalk and these do not disappoint. This is perfect, easy to lock/unlock, cuts through even thick branches like butter, and easy to hold/use 🙂 very happy with this purchase and highly recommend! Great price, quick shipping, and fabulous buying experience!! 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Awesome Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, did not work well
customer_reviews.text: I went with Fiskar due to the brand and being known as high quality. Started pruning and a few "younger" branches would get caught in it and not cut, instead would jam in between the blade and would splay apart. Young as in they are still semi green. The harder branches cut better but this is not what I expect, even kitchen scissor can cut those
customer_reviews.author: Harold Wong

customer_reviews.title: These are great pruners! They're very sharp and I'm pleased with ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great pruners! They're very sharp and I'm pleased with how well they've been able to cut through the branches and stems I've been pruning. I've kind of been using them more as trimmers because they were all I had at the time and they cut through some pretty thick bush branches on some of the bushes on the side of my house. The grip is also very comfortable and it's very easy to lock and unlock them one handed. I would definitely buy these again and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Historically reliable brand, perhaps not so much anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item as a gift in July. Just tried to use them in September and found that the spring is so weak, that the even before first use, the shears would not open on their own. The construction (weight) of this pair of shears seems lighter than similar Fiskars products. I do not recommend this particular product from Fiskars. I am outside of my return policy for Amazon. As these are unused shears, I will attempt a Limited Lifetime Warranty Exchange from Fiskars.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable clippers
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands, so comfortable clippers are important. These aren't too heavy, have sharp blades that require minimal force, and feel good in the hand. The handles are padded and large enough to be easy to grip. I paid ten dollars and feel like that was a good buy. There is a small locking mechanism that should be child resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Janet/ Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of pruning shears. Very easy to hold and cut with, and the lock is accessible with your thumb and is easy to lock and unlock. I became a fan of Fiskars after purchasing their 5 lb. pick, the best pick I have ever used. I have since purchased other Fiskar tools and have been happy with them all. They have ergonomics and quality at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: 3loops

product_meta.title: Fiskars Steel Bypass Pruning Shears (91095935J)
product_meta.description:
Item Package Quantity:1This reliable pruner is ideal for a variety of general pruning tasks. A fully hardened, precision-ground steel blade stays sharp longer, and a rust-resistant, low-friction coating makes cutting easier. A self-cleaning sap groove keeps the blades from sticking, and the handle includes non-slip grips. All-steel construction provides long-lasting durability. FROM THE MANUFACTURER Is it time again to tame the garden? If so, these coated pruning shears are ready to tackle the job. The cambered, beveled blade is made of non-stick high carbon steel so it cuts smoothly and easily. Shears feature an ambidextrous lock, sap groove, enclosed spring, and dual layer comfort grips.

Fiskars is a global company with manufacturing locations all over the world, including several places in the US. The 9109 Bypass Pruner is made in China. Many of Fiskars' blades are stainless steel. The blade on the 9109 is a coated, high carbon steel blade. To learn more about this pruner and other Fiskars products, please visit us at www.fiskars.com.
feature_bullets: Ideal for cutting stems and light branches. Easy-open lock protects the blade during transport and storage
Fully hardened, precision-ground steel blade stays sharp, even through heavy use
Low-friction coating helps blade glide through wood, prevents the blades from gumming up with sap and debris and helps the blades resist rust

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars10,241 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
